It largely depends on your audio hardware and where the hardware lives in your machine. For example, having a PCI audio card too close to the video card or other hardware could have crosstalk/noise
If it's an on-board audio chip, there's not a whole lot you can do to move it obviously
Ideally, you'd have a decent PCI card installed in the furthest PCI slot on the mobo
